---
title: "Sweet potato macaroni"
author: "[Meera Sodhas](https://www.theguardian.com/food/2020/mar/21/meera-sodhas-vegan-recipe-for-creamy-macaroni-with-sweet-potato-and-gochujang)"
categories: [pasta, vegan]
description: "Comforting and nutty with a little kick"
---

- 175g macaroni
- 1 medium sweet potato
- 50g cashews nuts, roasted and unsalted
- 2 garlic cloves
- 1 tbsp gochujang paste (or to taste)
- 2 tbsp white flour
- 2½ tbsp nutritional yeast
- 1 spring onion
- 30g breadcrumbs

1. Heat the oven to 180C fan. 

1. Cook pasta for 2 minutes less than packet says.

1. Peel and chop the sweet potato into 1cm cubes, and put them in a small saucepan with the cashews and a garlic clove. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 10 minutes.

1. Put in a blender with 500ml cold water, gochujang, flour, nutritional yeast and a 1 tsp of salt. 

1. Toss the macaroni with the sauce and transfer to a 20cm x 20cm dish.

1. Finely chop the spring onions and mince the remaining garlic clove.

1. Mix crushed garlic, oil, ½ tsp salt and breadcrumbs in a bowl to make a topping.

1. Top the macaroni with the crumbs and bake for 20 minutes, until golden and bubbling.
